intro: Aletris obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, blooming in the spring. Aletris obovata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and floral structure make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable component of its native habitat.
